page.title: 06Transport in Kensworth Area
page.content: The majority of people being commuters,rely on private cars for transport,many families having more than one car.United Counties runs a single-decker bus service through the village between Hemel Hempstead and Luton,mostly at two hourly intervals,one hour at peak times.There is a village taxi service.Air travel is close by at Luton Airport.Studham lies on the flight path and occasional planes stray overhead.The nearest railway stations are at Luton and Hemel Hempstead.Local roads carry commuter traffic at peak times between Dunstable,Hemel Hempstead,Luton and St.Albans.Local children travel to several surrounding schools on coaches provided by the local authority. Motor bikes are popular with teenagers who use them for both transport and pleasure.There are a few cyclists.
